item.title: Tracking down where disk space has gone on Linux
item.description: As a Linux administrator, I recently encountered a situation where one of my servers was displaying low disk utilization. To rectify the issue, I decided to employ a strategy of decluttering by removing any redundant files, including expired logs. In order to accomplish this task, I first established a secure remote connection to the server using ssh. Then, I embarked on the following series of steps to reclaim the precious disk space and restore optimal performance to my Linux system.

item.title: Make TeamViewer Work on Arch Linux
item.description: Problem Description I was trying to setup TeamViewer 15.4 on Arch (manjaro) Linux in office, so that I could remotely connect to it from my home computer, which is a MacBook also running TeamViewer. I had all the login credentials and stuff, but TeamViewer on ArchLinux said “Not Ready, Please check your connection”. It won’t allow me to log in or attempt to connect to anything. Then I checked the Internet connection, all worked fine.
